result.execSummary:
The defendant Dallas D Flinn was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Dallas D Flinn is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Dallas D Flinn was found guilty of Carry Concealed Weapon, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.23(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Dallas D Flinn in court with attorney Angele R. Dentice.  Katherine Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Justice point report received and filed.  

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant. 

The Court ordered the Defendant to serve EIGHT MONTHS  in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence with credit for 21 days time served.  NO Huber privileges.. Forthwith . 

 COURT OBJECTS TO ES. COURT OBJECTS TO EXPUNGMENT. Defendant to provide DNA sample. 

Court ordered defendant to pay all applicable court costs and  DNA surcharges from bail on deposit and balance  by 10-19-16  or, if not paid, civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant. 

.  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed.

Defendant Dallas D Flinn in court with attorney Angele R. Dentice.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Hearing proceeded.  

COUNT 1:  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.

COUNT 2:  Pursuant to plea negotiations and on state's motion the Court ordered Count 2 DISMISSED.


The Court orders defendant remanded pending sentencing.  Defense objects; argument heard.  The Court vacates order for remand and sets bail in the amount of $100.00 CASH.  Defendant escorted to Clerk of Circuit Court Room 117 by deputy sheriff to post bail.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 19, 2015 at 08:30 am.

  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 47. lr  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for 10-08-2015 at 08:30 am.

Status conference scheduled for August 3, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Status conference scheduled for October 14, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Dallas D Flinn in court with attorney Angele R. Dentice.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Justice point report received and filed.   Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 47. lr  Status conference scheduled for 06-24-2015 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.
    No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Dallas D Flinn in court with attorney Francisco Araiza.  Defendant Dallas D Flinn in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Siefert, Branch 47.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Status conference scheduled for June 8, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
